summary: Talented | innovative | analytical | technically minded | excellent spatial intelligence | communicative | problem solving | hands-on | experienced in various fields | eager to learn

school.name: Technical High School of Ship Building - CONRADINUM

projects.title: Miniature 3D printed, RC controlled vehicle w/ gearbox
projects.description:
I'm designing a mini mechanical drive for an RC controlled caterpillar track vehicle, including the gears and the differential with brakes for each wheel.
I want to mimic in micro scale the steering principle of the full size vehicle.
The plan is to miniaturise the vehicle as much as possible.
Eventually I have bought a 3D printer myself to be able to test different setups myself.  The XY point size is around 22 micrometers, 10 micrometers in the Z axis.
The gearbox poses a real challenge GD&T wise, it is really tricky in such a small scale using a common resin 3D printer.
The brass tubes are used as bearings.
For the sizes I’m printing more precise printer would be better but it’s out of my reach at the time being.

projects.title: A conversion of the 3D model for renderings into the 3D print ready model
projects.description:
3D print and design, 1:50 scale, Tiger I - WW2 German heavy tank.
I have converted my 3D reconstruction made for AJ-Press publishing in 2006 to the 3D print ready model.
I had access to the Stratasys Prime 3D printer for a long time. It’s a resin, poly jet printer, using support material for printing complex models. The resolution of 600DPI XY is not the best for this kind of project but yet enough for the decent effect.
It was also a test of this printer, and the 3D print in general for this kind of work.
All the original parts were modified for the 3D print purpose, some re-designed, dimensions and corners corrected to make the joints.
I have made several trial print outs to determine the limits of the 3D printer before continuing with the design.
I was continuing slowly as I was able to make 1 print per week only.
I was using my models for the maintenance prints of the printer. The maintenance prints had to be made every week, and this was my window of opportunity to build my model.

projects.title: 14 historical fishing boats
projects.description:
3D scanning, point cloud processing/ repairing, 3D modelling, 3D mesh editing/repairing, texturing of 14 historical fishing boats for Gdansk Maritime Museum in Hel.
Converting the 3D models into 3D PDF with textures, for the archives.
My friend was scanning using the Faro scanner, I was responsible for the point cloud editing, texturing and converting to the 3D PDF.
Not all the scans went smoothly. One boat was in a terrible state, on the edge of collapsing, taking scans from the deck was hazardous. We only had a few spots to place the scanner. As a result I had to improvise, basing on the pictures. There were areas on one side not covered by the scans. Points were copied/pasted from the similar areas from the other side, together with portholes and details, and adjusted accordingly based on the pictures of entire boat.
The job pushed the point cloud editing really far.

projects.title: Reconstructions - drawings and 3D renderings for publications
projects.description:
A long term cooperation with the AJ-Press publishing house.
Started in 1994 as a hand drafter, using technical ink pens (rapidographs)
Technical and 3D illustrations, reconstructions of different vehicles, from drawings and pictures, ink drafting, computer drafting, 3D modelling, texturing, rendering, DTP editing.
I really enjoyed this job.

projects.title: Graf Zeppelin aircraft carrier 3D reconstruction
projects.description:
The reconstruction was done for the publication about the ship for AJ-Press publishing.
I've been using original drawings that survived the war, as well as pictures from the shipyard taken by the German army. Main reconstruction was done basing on the drawings, but majority od details were reconstructed from the pictures.
This reconstruction (renderings) helped the divers confirm the discovery of the wreck of Graf Zeppelin on the bottom of the Baltic Sea.

profile_positions.description:
Design | 3D print design | product developement | manufacturing/3D printing/hand making | technical drawings | visualisations | technical illustrations | point cloud processing | sketching and drafting | digital reconstruction | maquette/model building | video and audio editing

I was cooperating and partnering with companies and designers, making visual materials such as visualisations, illustrations and models, for advertisements, presentations, shows and publishing.
For example:
2016 - Maritime heritage preservation programm - 3D scans of 14 historical fishing boats, convertion to 3D models with textures, for Maritime Museum of Gdansk.
2015 - Digitizing & editing maps of Gdansk by German cartographer Buhse in 1866-1669, preparing them for publishing.
2007 - together with the designers team we have won the first place in the interior design contest for Museum of Gdynia.
2004 - Author of 3D visualisations of Graff Zeppelin aircraft carrier,  published in the AJ-press magazine, that helped divers to recognize her wreck in the Baltic Sea.
1994-2006 - Author of the technical reconstructions, drawings, 3D renderings for publications at AJ-Press publishing.
profile_positions.title: Freelancer / Founder

volunteer_experiences.description:
Visual materials: 3D visualisations and model(3D printed) of the university graduation project for the exam and the exhibition.
The subject was a restoration of the hill observation deck tower in the forest.
The site survey: measuring, simple photogrammetry, pictures, had to be done in order to create the proper scenery, also to reproduce the actual surroundings.
The 3D model of the tower has been adjusted to the 3D print needs and printed.
The surroundings were hand modelled.

Helping my daughter with her school.
I was tutoring her in mathematics, physics and chemistry
